Bout the Position:

The IT PROJECT MANAGER/SCRUM MASTER is primarily responsible for planning, developing and executing a series of agile projects. They also create dashboards, basic analytics and predictive analytics. They manage project scrum teams and coach teams to implement agile project management methodologies involved in delivery of various IT software development and implementation of Advancio Client’s Projects .

Requirements

5+ years working as Project Manager in various industries specializing in IT projects.
2+ years proven experience working with Agile methodologies
Preferably to have developed code
Proven experience with reports and dashboards (Jira, Trello, Power BI, etc.)
Accountable for the segmentation, updating, administration and monitoring of the portfolio of projects.
Raise and optimization of processes.
Good technical understanding of software development.
Problem-solving skills and conflict management abilities.

Responsibilities:

Define the product vision and communicate it clearly to the team.
Manage and prioritize the product backlog in collaboration with the development team.
Work with internal and external stakeholders to gather and manage requirements.

Analyze data and user feedback to iterate and continuously improve the product.
Make decisions about the scope and features of the product based on customer and market needs.
Collaborate closely with the Scrum Master to ensure an efficient and collaborative workflow.

About you: You are very process-oriented and love making sure your team is working as efficiently as possible. You generate user stories and acceptance criteria, and collaborate with developers and designers.

Not stopping there, you contribute to the SDLC with processes and documentation benefiting the entire team. You're adept with agile development and introducing/adapting frameworks (e.g., Kanban, Scrumban) to the team. When you see a risk, you're the type of person to loop people in appropriately and take the initiative. You collaborate intelligently, knowing when to spin off a team, or complete a task solo.

Even when you're brushing your teeth, you're thinking about the user, continually wondering how the team can provide more value. You're always asking what the user wants, and thinking about how to provide them what they need. You can demo features and prototypes to users and generate valuable feedback about UX and adaptability.

We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced IT Project Manager to lead a range of projects within our dynamic Pinkerton Global Information Systems and Technology team. The candidate should have a strong understanding of Agile methodologies, including Scrum, and proficiency in using Azure DevOps or similar tools. The IT Project Manager will be responsible for creating custom project structures based on the unique nature of each project, managing timelines and processes in technology projects that typically span multiple lines of business and have company-wide implications. Additionally, they will be responsible for coordinating staff resources and providing support to the PMO's activities and processes. The IT Project Manager will

Essential Functions

Represent Pinkerton's core values of integrity, vigilance, and excellence.
Understand the broader strategy of Information System and Technology and the business, identifying future possibilities and translating into program execution, enabled by effective technology business operations.
Develop and implement project plans that incorporate Agile best practices to ensure the delivery of projects on time, within scope, and on budget. Be part of the full application lifecycle (design, develop, test, deploy and maintain) and innovation of each step.
Facilitate project-related meetings, including Scrum ceremonies such as sprint planning, daily stand-ups, sprint reviews, and retrospectives.
Create and maintain project structures in Azure DevOps or similar tools to support the management of backlogs, sprints, release plans, and other project-related artifacts.
Coordinate the assignment of project tasks and ensure that team members have the resources needed to complete their work efficiently.
Monitor project progress, manage risks and issues, support work, triaging work, and make adjustments to project plans as necessary to ensure project objectives are achieved as well as project documentation and reference materials.
Serve as a liaison between project teams and other departments, fostering collaboration and effective communication.
Provide coaching and mentorship to project teams on industry best practices, helping to cultivate a culture of continuous improvement.
Assist in the development and refinement of PMO policies, processes, and best practices, contributing to the improvement of project management capabilities across the organization.
Prepare and present project status reports to stakeholders, ensuring transparency and visibility into project performance.
Collaborate with IST Directors to ensure that projects are appropriately staffed and manage project resource allocation and scheduling conflicts.
Share responsibility with teammates for occasional after-hours on-call rotation for support of production level systems.
Stay up-to-date with industry best practices and trends in software technology.
All other duties, as assigned.

Education, Experience, and Certifications:

Bachelor's degree with 5+ years of IT project management experience. PMP (Project Management Professional) or Agile certification (such as CSM, PSM, or PMI-ACP) is desired. Experience dealing with global teams is preferred.

Competencies

Solid English written and verbal communication skills.
Experience with guiding change and shifting the focus to the future.
Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills.
Ability to create and maintain a cooperative team environment that promotes high performance standards and attainment of goals inside IST and across the organization.
Strong knowledge of Agile methodologies, Lean and Scrum framework, including experience as a Scrum Master or Agile Coach, as well as experience with scaling (several teams).
Experience using Azure DevOps for capturing and managing user requirements or similar project management tools is required.
Exceptional problem-solving, organizational, and time-management skills.
Hands-on experience using PowerBI for project management is a plus.
Knowledge of scalable platform architecture, end to end systems design, and architecture.

Working Conditions:

With or without reasonable accommodation, requires the physical and mental capacity to effectively perform all essential functions:

Exposure to sensitive and confidential information.
Regular computer usage.
Must be able to see, hear, speak, and write clearly in order to communicate with employees and/or customers.
Occasional reaching and lifting of small objects and operating office equipment.
Ability to adjust focus between close and distance vision.
Frequent sitting.

This is a very ambitious project and our roadmap is full of exciting features, so we’re looking for people who love innovation and want to be challenged. We’re a small team of scrappy individuals who are growing fast, and we’re looking for someone to grow with us.

What's this role about?

Reporting to the Engagement Manager, the Agile Project Managers will take responsibility for software delivery, support or maintenance projects, establishing, monitoring and controlling progress checkpoints and/or service level agreements. Ensure that assigned resources (staff, equipment, and services, funds, time) are properly utilized and accounted for and up-to-date usage of information is maintained. Establish the scope of the project and take full responsibility for the clear briefing and direction of staff using Agile methodologies. Plan the work with a team or project group within an Agile framework using appropriate planning tools, producing plans to standards required. Ensure the Agile disciplines are correctly followed and educate members of the team and the client that do not have the relevant experience. Monitor progress, producing reports on progress against plan according to standards, acting within authority to maintain progress whilst recognising areas requiring decision making in respect of budget, schedules, resources, working methods, staff matters and or technical difficulties. Demonstrate leadership skills in team building and staff motivation and assist with the assessment, development and mentoring of staff. Communicate effectively, both formally and informally, orally and in writing, on technical and non-technical issues with all those with whom working interfaces and iteration arise, whether colleagues, users or customers at all levels of seniority.

What skills and experience do you need?

You must have successfully completed the responsibilities defined above on previous projects and have the following:
PMP, Agile, Scrum, Kanban, Six Sigma, etc – Agile and Waterfall methods a requirement; PMP cert a nice to have. JIRA, Trello, SmartSheets, Trello, Asana, Microsoft Project, Miro, etc Scrum Master certification preferable. Experience in mentoring team members that have no previous agile experience. Knowledge of how to introduce Agile methodologies into new environments. Ability to enforce Scrum and other Agile principles and to explain the benefits to team members. Technical understanding and ability to provide some level of support/understanding to the consulting team. Excellent presentation skills and experience of presenting to senior level stakeholders. Highly self-motivated and able to work in an adaptable and flexible environment. An enthusiastic team player.

Responsibilities

Reporting to the IT PMO Director, the Agile Project Manager is responsible for ensuring that the projects are executed in line with all contractual obligations to the client in a professional, cost-effective and timely manner, ensuring that Finastra achieves (or improves upon) the planned financial return from the project; within this objective, you should give the client value for money.

The role of the Project Manager is to plan, execute, and finalize projects according to agreed deadlines and within the client’s budget using Agile, Waterfall, or Hybrid methodologies. This includes coordinating resources and efforts of consultants and/or third-party contractors in order to deliver projects according to plan or apply strong change control management as required. The Project Manager will also define the project’s objectives and oversee quality control throughout its life cycle. Job Description

The Digital Product Owner - Fiix will be the subject matter expert on our content management system and enable communication between the content authors, developers, and marketing to ensure the products are configured and optimized to deliver content to our customers. We seek a blend of business knowledge, technical expertise, and a user-centric mindset to lead successful product development.

The Digital Product Owner - Fiix will report to the Global Digital Marketing Experience Director.

Responsibilities

Define and communicate the strategy for FiixSoftware.com .
Conduct market research, user studies, and competitive analysis to identify opportunities and inform product strategy.
Collaborate with partners to align FiixSoftware.com roadmap with our goals.
Maintain a prioritized product backlog, ensuring an understanding of strategic objectives.
You will work with several groups, including user experience, content, development, and QA, to build product releases.
Prioritize features based on customer feedback, analytics, and market trends.
Elicit and document clear and detailed requirements, user stories, and acceptance criteria.
Collaborate with partners to ensure a shared understanding of product requirements and expectations.
Participate in Agile ceremonies such as sprint planning, backlog grooming, and daily stand-ups.
Provide guidance to development teams on product priorities and ensure delivery of features.
Review and accept completed user stories to ensure they meet acceptance criteria and quality standards.
Monitor measurements and user feedback to assess product performance and identify areas for improvement.
Improve on product features based on user feedback, A/B testing, and data-driven insights.
Improve through experimentation and optimization.
Be the primary contact for partners, providing regular updates on product status, roadmap, and risks.
Collaborate with our teams and external partners to gather input, manage expectations, and resolve conflicts.
Work with UX/UI designers to create intuitive and engaging user experiences.
Provide input on wireframes, prototypes, and design iterations to ensure agreement on product goals and user needs.

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.
3+ years experience working as a Product Owner, Product Manager, or similar role in digital product development.
3+ years experience working with Agile project management tools like JIRA, WorkFront, ClickUp.
3+ years experience working with collaboration tools like Salesforce Slack, Microsoft Teams, Confluence, and Miro.
3+ years experience working with Content Management Systems such as Adobe Experience Manager, Drupal, and WordPress.
Familiarity with programming languages such as JavaScript, HTML5, CSS, XML, and XSLT.
Knowledge of UX/UI principles and best practices.
3+ years experience with product analytics tools such as Adobe Analytics and Google Analytics.
